intro: Bashania qiaojiaensis, commonly known as the Qiaojia bashania, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments, typically in mountainous regions with cool, moist climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
